posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked:
Working with the Arducam ov9281 and ov9782, I found the goofy USB JST and USB A connector to be finicky. I created a circuit board to solder directly to the front of the camera to convert it to USB C. I’m trying to gauge if people would be interested in preordering / ordering this. I was thinking about offering a pre-soldered kit with the camera and just the circuit board. The solder connections are fairly small. I also created a case to be used with a locking USB C cable. I am still working on ideas and looking for recommendations for mounting.

posts.name: AllenGregoryIV
posts.cooked: What we have normally done is get a new USB extension cable and cut off the socket end so we can strip and solder the 4 USB wires directly to the front of the camera. This has been much more reliable for us than the connector on the back and the included cable.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: We would buy this

posts.name: viggy96
posts.cooked: Would definitely be interested in this.
+1 we’d buy a few. The latching connector for the USB C is a nice touch.

posts.name: MetabolicCloth
posts.cooked: Would the board you’re selling be completely DIY or would the USB C connector be soldered on already? Very interested in the board, we dislike the jst connectors.

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked: So thrifty now has the screw locking USB C cable if you really want to look for a reliable improvement.  Though maybe that would be a mod for a camera case and not the circuit board.

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked: I was looking for a reliable usb c cable that teams could purchase, however, it seems that thrifty only has locking USB C to USB C at this time.

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked: The boards would come with the USB C connector pre soldered. Teams would only have to solder the 4 usb pins and the reinforcement joints.

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked: Pre assembled cameras would also come with hotglued ribbon cables if the camera has it (like the ov9281) and the boards would be acrylic conformal coated. Then assembled in the case.

posts.name: MetabolicCloth
posts.cooked: Fantastic! That’s what I expected. Very excited about using these on our cameras, the JST are not rugged enough for high schoolers

posts.name: Anand Rajamani
posts.cooked:
I really like this design! I definitely feel like there’s a use for having it secured well inside of a case too.

Redux also sells a locking C to C canle, though it’ll be out of stock for a few more days: Locking USB-C to USB-C Cable

We also have a locking case design that uses it with the Zinc-V for power. I did order some locking A to C, but the screws tend to get in the way of other ports on coprocessors, so we havent made it available for sale right now. In general I’m a lot more worried about the fragile cables on the camera side than the large USB A that plugs into the coprocessor.

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked: I have ordered 250 pcbs that should be delivered in the next couple of weeks. I’m still working on the case design and going to test out some esd safe 3d printed cases. For testing I used this USB C cable https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0C7GKGBJW?ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_fed_asin_title&th=1 .

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked: I have the boards available for sale now on my etsy . I will be adding a video on how to solder it and a cad model for the case. I have decided for right now it is not very possible to sell the whole preassembled camera as I would have liked to initially.

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked: I posted the case to Printables Arducam OV9281 OV2311 Case by Juniormunk | Download free STL model | Printables.com . I printed it with support for the mounting tabs with the large flat face down. The mounting holes are 2.25" apart and are for 10-32 bolts.

link_counts.title: Arducam OV9281 OV2311 Case by Juniormunk | Download free STL model | Printables.com

posts.name: Jai Gupta
posts.cooked: Could you share the PCB gerber files?

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked:
I just updated the shipping cost for this. For some reason, the settings I had set caused Etsy to charge an astronomical price for shipping.

Here is the link again.

https://www.etsy.com/listing/1842851233/arducam-ov9281ov9782-usb-c-converter-pcb

posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked: I have updated the cost and packaging of these products, so instead of buying them individually, you get a 5-pack for $14.99. I noticed a lot of teams were only buying one or two which I don’t recommend. I recommend you have backups if you’re going to use them on your robot. We used these boards throughout the season with one issue which was soldering related.

posts.name: Paul Rensing
posts.cooked:
I like the convertor, but right now I could use a few replacement cables without modifying our cameras. Does anyone know exactly what the factory mounted connector is (there are lots of “JST” connectors)? Or does anyone have a listing for a replacement cable?

Thanks
